item.title: Barriers left and signage by the church, 7th August
item.description:

item.title: ^ cones, a large keep left sign and several large yellow barriers have been left behind after gas works in the area. They have been there for severaL weeks and are very close to the public footpath, 7th August
item.description:
Right at the top of Banady Lane near the fence into the field
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Tree overgrowth at junction of college bath road and Keynsham road, 7th August
item.description:
When approaching the junction to turn right onto Keynsham road from college bath road, the tree overgrowth at the bottom of the trees means you cannot see vehicles travelling along Keynsham road until it’s too late. I had a near miss this morning and there is going to be an accident here if there hasn’t been already. The trees need to be cut back
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Keynsham Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barrier and cone left by new railings that have been fitted in benhall park near to children’s play park as you walk on the path through the middle of the park towards willersley road, 7th August
item.description:
New railings have been fitted at the bridge by the path that cuts through the park by the children’s play park. Barriers and a cone have been left there and not removed. The path goes through to willersley road from bibury road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willersey Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lasne Crescent, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large cracks along length of cycle path that could trap a bike wheel and cause accident, 6th August
item.description:
The shared cycleway and footpath that runs from Liddington Road to the Premier Inn Barnwood. Many long cracks have been steadily getting wider along its entire length to the point that they are now wide enough to trap a bike wheel and cause a nasty accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
